Nightlight::

Nightlight didn't say anything else, but a tear rolled down from an 
eye

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "*Orchid*" <ilovealllizards@p...> wrote:
> Birdbot: You do!!!...That's how...You made me realize 
something...That I like females better then males....I looked forward 
to being friends with him and he betrayed me!!!...But you won't...
> 
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: airly2000@y... 
>   To: nbwrpg@y... 
>   Sent: Thursday, August 16, 2001 8:11 PM
>   Subject: Re: BIRDBOT!
> 
> 
>   Nightlight::
> 
>   "But you hate me..." replied Nightlight "you tried to kill me... 
how 
>   can I trust you? "
> 
> 
>   --- In nbwrpg@y..., "*Orchid*" <ilovealllizards@p...> wrote:
>   > Birdbot: You must trust me!!!...Normally I hate children, but I 
>   won't touch her if you come with me...And I won't kill you unless 
you 
>   drive me to that extreme...I love women...
>   > 
>   >   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   >   From: airly2000@y... 
>   >   To: nbwrpg@y... 
>   >   Sent: Thursday, August 16, 2001 7:50 PM
>   >   Subject: Re: BIRDBOT!
>   > 
>   > 
>   >   Nightlight::
>   > 
>   >   "I don't know what to say" said Nighlight with fear "How can 
I be 
>   >   sure that you won't kill me when we are away and after that 
you 
>   come 
>   >   back and try to kill Aerotaur and Trinity?"
>   > 
>   >   --- In nbwrpg@y..., "*Orchid*" <ilovealllizards@p...> wrote:
>   >   > (Birdbot is shot in his shoulder. He quickly moves his 
right 
>   hand, 
>   >   avoiding the staff by inches. He laughs at Aerotaur. He 
wouldn't 
>   >   attack though. He first wanted an answer from Nightlight...)
>   >   > 
>   >   >   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   >   >   From: Rudra656@a... 
>   >   >   To: nbwrpg@y... 
>   >   >   Sent: Thursday, August 16, 2001 6:26 PM
>   >   >   Subject: Re: BIRDBOT!
>   >   > 
>   >   > 
>   >   >   ::Aerotaur:: 
>   >   >         He stood very still unsure of how Birdbot would 
react.  
>   He 
>   >   slowly 
>   >   >   circled toward the wall so as to get a clean shot at 
>   Birdbot.  
>   >   Without 
>   >   >   lifting his left hand too high he fired a shot at 
Birdbot.  
>   He 
>   >   simultaneously 
>   >   >   swung with his bladed staff in his right hand.
